$$\begin{align}
\begin{pmatrix}
y_{1,1} \\
y_{1,2} \\
y_{2,1} \\
y_{2,2}
\end{pmatrix}
&=
\begin{pmatrix}
1 & x_{1,1} \\
1 & x_{1,2}  \\
1 & x_{2,1} \\
1 & x_{2,2}
\end{pmatrix}
\begin{pmatrix}
\beta_0 \\
\beta_1 \\
\end{pmatrix} 
+
\begin{pmatrix}
1 & x_{1,1} & 0 & 0 \\
1 & x_{1,2} & 0 & 0 \\
0 & 0 & 1 & x_{2,1} \\
0 & 0 & 1 & x_{2,2}
\end{pmatrix}
\begin{pmatrix}
b_{01} \\
b_{11} \\
b_{02} \\
b_{12}
\end{pmatrix}
+
\begin{pmatrix}
e_{1} \\
e_{2} \\
e_{3} \\
e_{4}
\end{pmatrix} 
\end{align}$$

Covariance matrix for b:
$$\begin{align}
\text{Cov}(\mathbf{b})=
\begin{pmatrix}
\sigma^2_{b01} & \sigma_{b11,b01} & 0 & 0 \\
\sigma_{b11,b01} & \sigma^2_{b11} & 0 & 0 \\
0 & 0 & \sigma^2_{b02} & \sigma_{b12,b02} \\
0 & 0 & \sigma_{b12,b02} & \sigma^2_{b12}
\end{pmatrix}
\end{align}$$

$$\begin{align}
\text{Cov}(\mathbf{b})=
\begin{pmatrix}
\text{Var(Intercept)} & \text{Cov(Intercept, Slope)} & 0 & 0 \\
\text{Cov(Intercept, Slope)} & \text{Var(Slope)} & 0 & 0 \\
0 & 0 & \text{Var(Intercept)} & \text{Cov(Intercept, Slope)} \\
0 & 0 & \text{Cov(Intercept, Slope)} & \text{Var(Slope)}
\end{pmatrix}
\end{align}$$


$$\begin{align}
E(Y) &= E(X\beta) + E(Zb) + E(e) \
&= X\beta + Zb + E(e) \
&= X\beta + \begin{pmatrix} b_{01} \ b_{11} \ b_{02} \ b_{12} \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & x_{1,1} & 0 & 0 \ 1 & x_{1,2} & 0 & 0 \ 0 & 0 & 1 & x_{2,1} \ 0 & 0 & 1 & x_{2,2} \end{pmatrix} + E(e) \
&= \begin{pmatrix} \beta_0 + \beta_1x_{1,1} + b_{01} + b_{11}x_{1,1} \ \beta_0 + \beta_1x_{1,2} + b_{01} + b_{11}x_{1,2} \ \beta_0 + \beta_1x_{2,1} + b_{02} + b_{12}x_{2,1} \ \beta_0 + \beta_1x_{2,2} + b_{02} + b_{12}x_{2,2} \end{pmatrix} + E(e)
\end{align}$$
where X is the design matrix for the fixed effects, Z is the design matrix for the random effects, b is the vector of random effects, and e is the vector of residual errors.
The covariance matrix of Y can then be obtained as:
$$\begin{align}
\text{Cov}(Y) &= E[(Y - E(Y))(Y - E(Y))^T] \\
&= E[(X\beta + Zb + e - X\beta - \begin{pmatrix} b_{01} + b_{11}x_{1,1} \\ b_{01} + b_{11}x_{1,2} \\ b_{02} + b_{12}x_{2,1} \\ b_{02} + b_{12}x_{2,2} \end{pmatrix} - E(e))(X\beta + Zb + e - X\beta - \begin{pmatrix} b_{01} + b_{11}x_{1,1} \\ b_{01} + b_{11}x_{1,2} \\ b_{02} + b_{12}x_{2,1} \\ b_{02} + b_{12}x_{2,2} \end{pmatrix} - E(e))^T] \\
&= E[(Zb + e - \begin{pmatrix} b_{01} + b_{11}x_{1,1} \\ b_{01} + b_{11}x_{1,2} \\ b_{02} + b_{12}x_{2,1} \\ b_{02} + b_{12}x_{2,2} \end{pmatrix}\end{align}$$
